fields.description:
As a scrum team member

I want the Jira velocity chart to match the ideas of scrum

So I don't need to repeatedly explain/rationalize this chart to my stakeholders

 

Acceptance criteria:
 * "Committed" on the velocity chart is renamed to "Planned"

 

Business case:

When Scrum teams plan a Sprint they commit to a _*sprint goal*_. They do not commit to a sprint backlog, and they do not commit to a number of issues or total story points/hours to complete. The velocity chart uses terms which forward the anti-pattern of treating velocity like a "stick" with which to punish teams when it is not achieved. The term "committed" also leads stakeholders to negative perceptions of teams who successfully meet a sprint goal and do not finish all the work in sprint backlog. These effects combine to incentivize teams to under-plan based upon their capacity (so they always finish "committed"), and/or to discover elaborate Jira work-arounds to alter sprint scope for reporting.

For further information, I respectfully recommend the product owner for this chart review guidance from the authors of Scrum on scrum.org
fields.summary: revise sprint velocity chart language to replace "committed"

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary

If you navigate to an URL pointing to a non-existing board (or have a URL saved that's pointing to a non-existing board), you will be redirected to the board's section with an error message *Board not found*.

That's expected. But, the problem is that even if you navigate trough Jira and try accessing other boards or projects, you will keep being redirected to the same error message. 

You can still access the issues, but you won't be able to access the boards of the projects.

h3. Steps to Reproduce

* Access an URL pointing to a non existing board
** You can change the value of the parameter *rapidView* in the URL to an ID that you know that does not exist yet.
* After receiving the *Board not found* error, try to navigate to other projects or boards.

h3. Expected Results

You will be able to access other projects or boar when navigating trough Jira.

h3. Actual Results

You will keep being redirected to the error message.

Here's a recording:  [^Board not found error.mp4] 

h3. Workaround

Close the current tab in your browser, and access Jira again in a new tab. Manually navigate to the desired project normally.
fields.summary: Navigating to an invalid URL will prevent you from accessing other boards

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary

In Github, when the pull request is auto approved and merged using the github-bot, the status would not reflect in the corresponding Jira issue. whilst, the manual merge would update the status in Jira.
h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Use one of the auto-approve action from github marketplace.
 # create a workflow and add the auto-approve.yml file in the workflow. 
 # Similarly use one of the auto-merge action from github marketplace. 
 # add the automerge.yml file in the workflow -> in this case, it would need a label as "auto-merge" to trigger the bot
 # Create PR -> the bot will automatically trigger the workflow actions that has been specified. 
 # Once done, you will notice that the status has been changed to "Merged" however, Jira would still show as "Open".
 # With the manual update, you will not notice this problem. 

+*Using Bot :*+ 

!Using_bot_merge.gif|width=530,height=260!

+*Manual update :*+ 

!manual_merge.gif|width=512,height=256!
h3. Expected Results

Jira to synchronize the status irrespective of the status been updated by bot or manually. 
h3. Actual Results

Jira does not synchronize the status.
h3. Workaround

No workaround
fields.summary: GitHub : PR status does not update in jira when using github-bot

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary
The Sprint field picker on the issue edit/view screen won't show all the available Sprint names if the future Sprints are created with more than 9 numerical sequences.

Also, the Sprint field won't allow the manual update of the Sprint name. Especially, the Sprint name with the single-digit won't be shown in the suggestion.

h3. Steps to Reproduce
* Create Sprint on any board with a pattern like:
** "TT Sprint 3", "TT Sprint 30", "TT Sprint 31", "TT Sprint 31"....."TT Sprint 38".
 !Existing Sprints.png|thumbnail! 
* The Sprint field picker on the issue view screen would hide the "TT Sprint 3" once the "TT Sprint 38" is created.
!Suggestion.png|thumbnail! 


h3. Expected Results
The Sprint picker should show all the matching suggestions and allow the user to choose any sprint name.

h3. Actual Results

The Sprint name with the single-digit won't be shown. Eventually, the user can't select the desired sprint. The scroll option also won't show the Sprint name.

h3. Workaround

* Delete a few of the future sprints if there are no issues tagged to them.
* Or, update the Sprint using the bulk update option.
fields.summary: Sprint picker won't suggest all the future Sprint names in issue screen

fields.description:
There is a difference how the Burndown chart behaves in between Jira Cloud and Jira Server.

- In Jira Server, the *Burndown chart* displays both "Worklogged" and "RTE" at the smae time.
- In Jira Cloud, time for "Work logged" event is when you start working and for RTE its when you are logging the time

Steps to reproduce:
1. Open Scrum Board settings > Estimation
2. Track time using "Remaining Time and Estimation" (attached screenshot)
3. Add issues to a new sprint and start it.
4. Log work in the Sprint Issues.
5. The "Date Started" will change according to the time you log your work but the RTE takes the current time.

h3. For Example, 
As you can see In the below screenshot, I entered *time spent* as *1 Hour* which makes the *Date Started* as *1:33 PM* and *{color:red}my current Time{color}* is *{color:red}2:33 PM{color}*

attached screenshot - Screenshot 2021-03-12 at 2.33.58 PM.png

After logging time, refer to the Burndown chart, and you notice that the "Worklog " event is tracked at 1:33 PM and the RTE is at 2:33 PM

- On the other hand, if we talk about the Jira Server, both the "Work log" and "RTE" are tracked at the same time.

attached screenshot - Screenshot 2021-03-12 at 2.39.05 PM.png

h3. Impact
We couldn't read the burndown chart properly when we migrate to the Jira server to the Jira cloud. Our coworkers couldn't make sense of the remaining time estimate graph because of different behavior between Jira Cloud and Jira Server burndown charts.
fields.summary: In Jira Cloud, please make the "Work logged" and "RTE" time under "Burndown chart" same

fields.description:
Add the "Dependency Scheduling" functionality to the new interface of Advanced Roadmaps.

See the screenshot:

!Portfolio Dependency Setting.png!
fields.summary: Add the "Dependency Scheduling" functionality to the new interface of Advanced Roadmaps

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary

Recreating the Done resolution in a Jira instance with existing next-gen projects will make transitioning issues to Done in the existing next-gen projects to not set a resolution.
h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Step 1
 ** Create a new next-gen Kanban project and configure it
 # Step 2
 ** In Jira resolutions edit the Done resolution and set it to other name (e.g. Done2)
 ** Create a new resolution with the name Done
 ** Delete the old Done resolution (Done2) and move existing issues to the new Done
 #  Step 3
 ** In the previously created project create a new issue and move it to the Done column

h3. Expected Results

Issue should have the Resolution field set to Done
h3. Actual Results

Issues transitioned before deleting the old Done resolution will point to the new Done resolution but all issues transitioned to Done after the delete won't have a resolution set.

!resolution.png|width=229,height=114!

 
h3. Workaround
 * Create a new column in the next-gen project
 * Edit the workflow, set the column status to done and save
 * Edit the workflow, remove the new column and select the Done column as the new column with the Done status upon prompt.

!prompt.png|width=227,height=144!

This steps will remap the original Done column to the correct resolution ID but all existing issues will have to be re-transitioned to Done to fill their resolution.

You can also use this new column as the new Done, transition all issues currently assigned to the old status and recreate any rules set to that transition.
fields.summary: Deleting Done resolution in Jira breaks existing next-gen projects resolution

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary

When connecting [a project to a Confluence space|https://confluence.atlassian.com/cloudkb/the-new-pages-feature-in-jira-software-project-958770525.html], if the Confluence space [does not have a home page|https://support.atlassian.com/confluence-cloud/docs/configure-the-site-homepage/], the *Pages* session will be empty, prompting the user to add pages, even though the space has pages.
h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Make sure that both Jira and Confluence are connected to allow the integration to work.
 # Create a project in Jira.
 # Have a space created in Confluence, that currently has pages within it.
 # Make sure that the confluence space does not have a homepage configured. If the space already has a home page, you can [delete it|https://support.atlassian.com/confluence-cloud/docs/delete-restore-or-purge-a-page/], which will keep the space without the home page.
 # In Jira, go to *Pages*, ** on the sidebar.
 # There, tap the ellipsis button at the top right and then, *Connect to a different space*

(i) If the space has a home, but, no child pages, the same behavior will be triggered.
h3. Expected Results

The pages from the space should be displayed.
h3. Actual Results

No pages are displayed. Only the option to create new pages will be available.
h3. Workaround

Currently, there is no known workaround for this behavior. A workaround will be added here when available
fields.summary: Connecting to a space without a home page will not display its pages in the project

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary
Using the Advanced Search of JQL, when we try to filter issues by the custom field named as *Team*, if we use = "{color:red}<custom field value>{color}", no issues are retrieved even though there are issues with such value.

h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Add a value to the custom field value *Team* in an issue
 # Head to the JQL Advanced Search page
 # Search for: Team = "{color:red}<custom field value>{color}",

h3. Expected Results
Issues with correspondent value would be displayed.

h3. Actual Results
No issues are displayed.

h3. Workaround
 Currently there is no known workaround for this behavior. A workaround will be added here when available
fields.summary: Cannot filter issues on the Advanced Roadmaps "Team" field using exact value

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary

Auto-scheduling doesn't return correct calculation results for time based estimations with planned capacities
h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Configure a plan to use time-based planning unit (days or hours)
 # Create a few issues with estimations, for example 20 hours
 # Update the planned capacities for a couple of future sprints, for example 40 hours (the default is 200 hours for 2 weeks)
 # Run auto-scheduling

h3. Expected Results

Planned capacities are considered by auto-scheduling and issues are pushed to further sprints when there is no enough capacity in current sprint
h3. Actual Results

Issues are scheduled into the same sprint and allocated time exceeds the sprint capacity
!Screen Shot 2021-03-11 at 9.43.31 pm.png|thumbnail!
h3. Workaround

Currently there is no known workaround for this behavior. A workaround will be added here when available
fields.summary: Auto scheduling doesn't return correct results for time-based estimations with planned capacities

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary
Release tab shows the issue count in unit hours which is wrong

h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Open a Jira advanced roadmap plan 
 # Click on release tab to observe the release level details
 # Hover the mouse over any of the issue count 

h3. Expected Results
Release level details should be shown with the issue count column should be shown . Hovering on the column should display inprogress, done, todo issue count 

h3. Actual Results
 !Screen Shot 2020-11-19 at 4.10.05 pm.png|thumbnail! 

Issue count shows the issue count as hours, which is wrong

h3. Workaround
 Currently there is no known workaround for this behavior. A workaround will be added here when available
fields.summary: Release tab shows the issue count in unit hours when hover on the column

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary
Advanced Roadmaps Filtered Issues "Ungray" when hovered over
h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Use any filter from a Plan
 # Hover the mouse pointer to issues that are greyed out and they will get highlighted

h3. Expected Results
The issues that are greyed out should only get highlighted when hovering the mouse pointer
h3. Actual Results
The issues that got the mouse pointer hover remain highlighted until the web browser is refreshed and this confuses the current Filter in use for the users:
 !screenshot-1.png|thumbnail! 
 !screenshot-2.png|thumbnail! 

h3. Workaround

Refresh the web browser
fields.summary: Advanced Roadmaps Filtered Issues "Ungray" when hovered over

fields.description: Hi I have a deal dependent on the ability to redirect signers to custom URL landing page. The client is evaluating Part 11 for a large study, and cannot get approval for signing flow when the signer is routed to their free DS account, and see the "Buy" button in the corner of the page. They will look into other vendors by 3/12 if there is no way to redirect the signer with Resource File Branding. Thank you
fields.summary: Part 11 URL Redirect Enhancement Request

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary

While in a a Kanban board of a standard project you cant search for the ID through browser search (Ctrl + F).

If you inspect a ID from an issue in the HTML it seems to be rendering the ID in the HTML in a different manner.

  !html.png|thumbnail!
h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Step 1
 ** Open a Kanban board of a standard project
 # Step 2
 ** Search for an existing ID visible in the board

h3. Expected Results

User should be able to find the issue with entered ID.
h3. Actual Results

As soon as the hyphen is added in the search it returns no results.

!TT.png|width=261,height=151!

!TT-2.png|width=261,height=150!
h3. Workaround

Search for the second part of the key only if the first is the same in all issues.
fields.summary: Using browser search by ID will not find issue keys with hyphen

fields.description:
h3. Problem Definition

We are not able to add rules to date/time fields and have them be compared against dynamic values, e.g. now, -7d, etc. Instead, we need to pick a specific date/time.
 !image-2021-03-10-11-40-20-873.png|thumbnail! 

h3. Suggested Solution

Ability to use dynamic values for date/time fields in next-gen rules
h3. Why this is important

It is painful to constantly update the hardcoded date/time ti a new value.
fields.summary: Ability to use dynamic values for date/time fields in next-gen rules

fields.description:
Possibility to use multiple issues shortcuts as 'L' to edit issues' labels in search view, while in new issue view.

This shortcut was operational in the old issue view and the customers think that is a good feature to be implemented in the new issue view
fields.summary: Possibility to use issues' shortcuts in search view while using new issue view

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary
Creating new issue(s) from a Plan will create duplicate issues if the user who is saving changes doesn't have 'Schedule issues' project permission.

h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Make sure the user who is going to work on the plan doesn't have 'Schedule issues' permission in the project level.
# Create an Advanced Roadmap plan using a Classic scrum/kanban board as issue source.
 !bug_01.png|thumbnail! 
# Create new issue in the plan level. Here in this example, 'Epic 2' is the new issue created in the plan.
 !bug_02.png|thumbnail! 
# Click on 'Review changes' > 'Save selected changes in Jira'.
# User will be shown a warning messages saying that the 'Changes couldn't be saved'.
 !bug_03.png|thumbnail! 

h3. Expected Results
Since the 'Changes couldn't be saved' warning is displayed, the new issue should not be created in Jira project.

h3. Actual Results
The process creates a new issue, and still retain the unsaved changes in the plan level. Notice newly created AD-10 issue, and still unsaved 'AD Epic 2' in the plan.
 !bug_04.png|thumbnail! 

h3. Additional Notes
Every time the user tries to save changes to Jira, the process keep on creating multiple duplicate issues.

h3. Workaround
Discard the changes in the plan level, and create new issues directly from Jira board.
OR
Grant 'Schedule issues' permission to the user who is saving the changes from the plan.
fields.summary: Creating new issue(s) from a Plan will create duplicate issues if the user who is saving changes doesn't have 'Schedule issues' project permission

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary

When splitting issues, the images added to the description are shown as “Failed to load”
h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Go to the backlog of a Classic project.
 # Right-click on an issue that has attachments on the description.
 # Add the summary and click “Split”.

h3. Expected Results

The new issue will be created with the details from the original issue, including the attachments from the description.
h3. Actual Results

The images on the description will show as “Failed to load”.
h3. Workaround
Try cloning the issues and ensure the *Include attachments* is checked
fields.summary: When splitting issues, the images added to the description are shown as “Failed to load”

fields.description:
h3. Summary

With the fix implemented for [JSWCLOUD-19327|https://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JSWCLOUD-19327], in order to have edit access to a Plan users require to have both *Edit* permission in the Plan access and also the *Advanced Roadmap User* permission on a global level.

Even while having *Edit* permission in the Plan access, users will still be restricted if they are not an *Advanced Roadmap User* since the global permission overrides this.

The problem with this logic is that by having the *Advanced Roadmap User* permission these users are also able to create their own Plans and no restrictions can be applied.

h3. Proposed solution

The *Advanced Roadmap User* permission on the Global Advanced Roadmaps permissions should be split into 2 separate permissions where admins would be able to manage users who are able to create Plans and potentially make them private.

* Advanced Roadmaps User: Ability to view, and edit plans.
* Advanced Roadmaps Creator: Ability to create, view, and edit plans.
fields.summary: Plan level permissions

fields.description:
We are working with several Jira Cloud endpoints and there are some descriptions that, in our opinion, could be improved, such as:
h3. Search for issues using JQL (GET)

Within the description of the {{SearchResults}} object we find:
 * *maxResults*
 The maximum number of results that could be on the page. 

 * *total*
 The number of results on the page.

We think this description is a bit confusing, as it seems that the value of {{total}} con only be less or equal to {{maxResults}}.
----
Another improvement would be to have the same descriptions for the same parameters  in every endpoint. For example, these are the parameters descriptions of the {{PageBeanScreen}} object:
 * *maxResults*
 The maximum number of items that could be returned.

 * *total*
 The number of items returned.

We believe that they should be the same descriptions even if they are different objects.
----
Our last suggestion is that all calls that return paged elements should have the same parameters.
||SearchResults||PageBeanScreen||
|expand|self|
|(x) |nextPage|
|maxResults|maxResults|
|startAt|startAt|
|total|total|
|(x) |isLast|
|...|...|

 

For example, object {{SearchResults}} does not return the {{isLast}} parameter. This parameter is very interesting to know if there are more elements that the call has not returned.

From our point of view, if all calls would follow a common format returned parameters, it makes it easier for the developer to use them.
fields.summary: Improve Jira Cloud Developer REST API documentation

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary

Git keywords and technical terms are being translated into other languages in the development panel and dialog. Such terms are not normally translated and should usually remain in English.
h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Change the language settings to something other than English.
 # Open the development panel and dialog in the issue view.

h3. Expected Results

Git keywords, including branch and commit, and some other technical terms (probably "pull request", "build" and "deployment"), should not be translated. These terms should normally remain in English, especially those which are used in command-line tools.
h3. Actual Results

!image-2021-03-08-21-46-18-780.png!

 

!image-2021-03-08-21-46-48-487.png!
h3. Workaround

Currently there is no known workaround for this behavior.
fields.summary: Git keywords and technical terms in the development panel and dialog should not be translated.

fields.description:
h3. Summary

While setting the start & end date of a sprint, the datetime picker UI still shows in 12hrs format (AM/PM). Even though the date format has been changed to 24hrs in Jira settings.
h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Click on Settings > System > General Configuration, select Advanced Settings
 # Change the date Time range picker format to 24h format using this documentation:
 ** [https://confluence.atlassian.com/jira063/how-to-change-the-date-time-range-picker-format-to-24h-format-683542334.html]
 # Go to Scrum board and create sprint and add any issue to the sprint
 # Click the start sprint option and when setting the dates and times for it to start/end, press the calendar icon.

h3. Expected Results
The pop up calendar shows the time in 24h when selecting the date and times.

h3. Actual Results
The time is still shown in 12h format. It is "translated" correctly to 24h in the resulting date, but the UI of the date picker itself still shows AM/PM.
 !screenshot-1.png|thumbnail! 

 h3. Notes
The issue only exist when changing the start/end date of a sprint. Everywhere else does not show a similar issue.
fields.summary: Sprint date picker UI shows 12h format despite setting it to 24h

fields.description: Would be great to have next-gen projects become visible in Advanced Roadmap.  This makes sense as more and more projects are created in next-gen.
fields.summary: Ability to view next-gen projects in Advanced Roadmaps

fields.description:
The assumption that the last column of a board means "Completed" is too rigid for many workflows.

For example, I have a "To be released" column where we have completed features, but want them visually separate to make it easy to see how much is going in the next release without having to switch to issue search view.

It would be nice if you could configure either a set of statuses (you can already specify if a status is considered completed), or a Resolution to consider the issue done according to burndown.
fields.summary: Allow configuring the definition of "Completed" for burndown

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary
When an issue is transitioned with Automation the board is not refreshing automatically like when you do the transition directly

h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Create an Automation rule that transitions the issue 
 # In the board click on any issue to see it in the pop-up view and trigger the rule
 # If you click back in the board the issue remains in the same column until you refresh manually the page

Video with the behavior:
https://share.getcloudapp.com/qGuX4j5D


h3. Expected Results
The board should refresh automatically like it is refreshed when you transition the issue directly

h3. Actual Results
A manual refresh is needed

h3. Workaround
Refresh the page manually
fields.summary: When an issue is transitioned with an Automation the board is not refreshing automatically

fields.description:
We work in Next gen software project and are missing options when we change the workflow:
 # Rule - Assign issue to someone - Reporter
 # Rule - Assign issue to someone - Assignee
 # Rule - Assign issue to someone - Field People
 # Create a new status - Done. Now you can only add one Done status, but I am missing the option Rejected or Trash can
fields.summary: Add transition rules

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary

The Sprint Burndown Gadget is displayed with a "{{An internal server error occurred when requesting resource.}}" error.

*Update:* other gadgets might be affected. E.g. Average number of times in status, agile wallboard gadget, etc.


h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Add the Sprint Burndown Gadget to your Dashboard

h3. Expected Results

The gadget is expected to display the burndown of current Sprints.

h3. Actual Results

 !Public_Dashboard_-_Jira.png|thumbnail! 

h3. Workaround

Currently, there is no known workaround for this behavior. A workaround will be added here when available
fields.summary: Gadgets returning internal server error

fields.description:
When saving a comment the Save and Cancel button are millimeters apart with no button outline on the Cancel button.  It is very annoying to enter a long detailed comment and then accidentally cancel it (as I've done on multiple occasions) with no prompt or ability undo the cancel.

It would be great if you could do one of the following:
 * Add an undo for comment cancel
 * Move the cancel button further away from the Save button
 * Add a confirm prompt on cancel
fields.summary: Prevent accidentally cancelling comments

fields.description:
As a user, I would like to use the DevOps automation triggers to be compatible with BitBucket Server, Bitbucket Data Center, GitLab On-Premise and GitHub Enterprise. Currently, as per this [document|https://support.atlassian.com/jira-software-cloud/docs/automation-triggers/#Automationtriggers-Branchcr] this feature only works with BitBucket Cloud, GitLab, GitHub and BigBrassBrand.

It is important to mention that DVCS in general is not supported in automation, as long as repositories connect through DVCS, automation triggers for repository actions will not work. This is more important now that [workflow triggers are marked as deprecated|https://community.atlassian.com/t5/Jira-Software-questions/When-are-the-workflow-triggers-for-branches-going-to-deprecate/qaq-p/1611693] and that Automation is meant to replace it.
fields.summary: Allow DevOps Automation triggers to work with BitBucket Server, Bitbucket Data Center, GitLab On-Premise and GitHub Enterprise

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary

When the Quick filter "Only my issues" is selected on the Agile wallboard gadget, all the issues are listed. Users are required to go to the Board, apply the Quick filter there and come back to the Agile wallboard gadget and refresh it to see the expected results.
h3. Steps to Reproduce

Create an Agile Wallboard Gadget, select a Board, select the Quick filter "Only my issues".
h3. Expected Results

Only the issues belonging to the User who is logged in should be displayed on the gadget.
h3. Actual Results

All the issues from the Board are displayed, Quick filter is not obeyed.
h3. Workaround

Users are required to go to the Board, apply the Quick filter on it and then refresh the Gadget to see the expected results.

This bug is related to BUG JSWCLOUD-15805 which is closed as fixed. But customer is still experiencing the issue.
fields.summary: Agile Wallboard Gadget - Quick filters do not work

fields.description:
h3. Problem

Currently, we can add a lot of child issues to an Epic, but it's not possible to organize them to get a better visibility (when using Classic projects + New issue view it's not possible to change the order of the child issues) and there is no option to group the issues by priority, created date, issue type, sprint.
h3. Suggestion

The ability to group the child issues by Sprint would allow us to have visibility of the feature schedule without having to find the Epic in the Backlog view and select it there.
fields.summary: Ability to group "Issues in this Epic"

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary

Release Burndown report includes sprints from other versions/releases when multiple sprints are running in parallel
h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # On a scrum board, create multiple sprints
 # create issues on each sprint
 # create multiple releases
 # update the issues on each sprint to its own version/release
 # run the Release Burndown report

h3. Expected Results
 * Per selected Version, only the sprints that are part of that version should be present

h3. Actual Results
 * Sprints that are part of other versions are showing in the report

h3. Workaround

Currently there is no known workaround for this behavior. A workaround will be added here when available
fields.summary: Release Burndown report includes sprints from other versions/releases

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary
Advanced Roadmaps for Jira sorting incorrectly by Priority

h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Add a new priority *Critical* and move it to the top of the list
  !2021-03-04_12-08-04.png|thumbnail! 

 # Sort the issue by priority
  !2021-03-04_12-08-41.png|thumbnail! 

h3. Expected Results
* The Issues will be sorted by Priority - Ascending or Descending

h3. Actual Results
* The issue are sorted incorrectly. See screenshot above

h3. Workaround
* Currently there is no known workaround for this behavior. A workaround will be added here when available
fields.summary: Advanced Roadmaps for Jira sorting incorrectly by Priority

fields.description:
Global templates that are disabled on Confluence are still suggested in the Popular templates list on Jira issue, Project pages section.
h3. Steps to reproduce the issue:
 # Log in to Confluence > Settings > Global Templates and Blueprints > Select a Template under section "Global page blueprints" and click on "disable"
 # Log in to Jira > Select a project > In the Project pages section > Connect the project to a Confluence space
 # Select the disabled template to Create a page

 
h3. Expected Result:

Disabled templates should not be visible or the user should not be allowed to select those templates to create a page.
h3. Actual Result:

Disabled template are available to be selected, below warning will be displayed if we proceed to Create a page with disabled template.


 !screenshot-1.png|thumbnail!
h3. Suggested Solution:

Disabled templates shouldn't be visible or users shouldn't be allowed to select those templates to create a page.
fields.summary: Jira Project pages section shows the Templates that are disabled on Confluence

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary

At the moment it is not possible to focus/ grab the backlog scrollbar to move it around. For a very long backlog, it takes a while to scroll to the bottom.
h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Using a mac and chrome
 # Navigate to the backlog
 # Try to scroll down using the scrollbar handle

h3. Expected Results
 - To be able to grab the scrollbar handle and fast scroll to the bottom or where ever

h3. Actual Results
 - Unable to successfully grab focus on the scrollbar handle, preventing fast scrolling


h3. Workaround

Scroll up and down using the mouse or trackpad/ touchpad
fields.summary: Ability to focus / grab the scrollbar handle in the backlog

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary

I’m not getting issues to show up in my roadmap by using the {{label}} filter. I have a view that groups labels by 1 set of labels. I then want to filter by _a different_ label, *not* in the grouped labels.I made a short video to show this. Any suggestions on how I can get my desired functionality?

 

I couldn't find the right version of Hello for Jira Roadmaps, so I picked the first one that I saw.
h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Please watch the video [^Jira roadmap filter issue using group by label.mov]

h3. Expected Results

A filtered view
h3. Actual Results

Nothing (i.e. no issues even through some issues have fit the criteria)

The below exception is thrown in the xxxxxxx.log file:
{noformat}
...
{noformat}
h3. Workaround

 

No workaround. I don't have the access to make components, so I have to use labels. Maybe I could make a new project?
fields.summary: Adding a filter using a `label` on an existing view that groups other, different labels results in no issues showing up

fields.description: In the UI you can go to https://yourdomain.atlassian.net/secure/project/ViewProjects.jspa and see the list of projects with the last issue update data, it would be very helpful to export that into a CSV file to review it in excel for example.
fields.summary: Have the option to export the Project last issue update page

fields.description: In classic Projects´there's not an option that sum of the story points of the backlog,
fields.summary: Sum of Storyt Points in backlog

fields.description:
h3. Problem

When viewing an issue through a board, we are unable to see the restrictions available on the comment. It is set by default to *viewable to all users* and when opening the issue directly (not through a board) the restriction options comes up on the comment.
h3. Environment

Jira Software- Boards
 .
h3. Steps to Reproduce

Set an issue security on a project and assign certain groups( example -Administrator)
 Create an issue and from the board open the issue and add a comment to it. 
 The restriction is not available. By default the only option set is viewable to all users.
h3. Expected Results

The issue security restriction ( group Administrators) should be available on the comment
h3. Actual Results

The issue security restriction ( group Administrators) in not available on the comment.
h3. Workaround

Switch to old issue view from the issue
h3. Notes
fields.summary: Issues from Boards not showing the Issue security restriction on comments

fields.description:
As a dashboard creator, I would like parent links to show as coloured lozenges so that I can easily identify groups of user stories, technical tasks and bugs within my dashboard.

Epic Links within Dashboards show the colour of the epic. Parent Links within Dashboards do not. This makes it hard to visually represent groups of items within filter gadgets in the Dashboards.
fields.summary: JIRA Parent Link Colours in Dashboards

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary

Commits received from Github/Fisheye are shown in an arbitrary order on the detail dialog.

They should be sorted by timestamp.
h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Connect a Github account to a Jira site
 # Make commits in Github mentioning an issue key in Jira
 # Go to the commits tab for the Jira issue
 # Observe that commits may be out of order

A similar behaviour is also seen for Fisheye integration too.
h3. Expected Results

Expect commits to be shown in order from most recent
h3. Actual Results

Commits may be shown out of order
h3. Workaround

Currently there is no known workaround for this behavior. A workaround will be added here when available
fields.summary: Commits shown in arbitrary order in detail dialog

fields.description:
As a team using Kanban with Jira boards

I want to configure my constraints (WIP limits) by step, not only by column

So we have an accurate picture of workflow issues in our delivery

 

Acceptance criteria
 * Minimum and maximum number contraints can be set by column (current behavior)
 * Minimum and maximum number constraints can be set for a set of columns
 * When constraints are defined for a set of columns the value is shown above the set of columns
 * When constraints are defined for a set of columns, and the constraints are exceeded, all columns in the set are highlighted

 

Business case

Teams can visualize their workflow with a Kanban board. Often such boards show team workflow as a series of process steps. And to manage flow, the steps may be further divided into "doing" and "done", where the "done" column is the pool of items that have completed and not yet been pulled into the next step. For example, "Dev Doing" and "Dev Done".

WIP limits apply to both "doing" and "done", so showing one limit spanning both would provide a more accurate picture for teams of their workflow.  In the example below, "Dev" should have one WIP limit, including all items in the sub-columns of "Dev Doing" and Dev Done".

 
||Selected||Dev Doing||Dev Done||Test Doing||Test Done||Releasing||Done||
|ITEM-5|ITEM-4|ITEM-3| |ITEM-2| |ITEM-1|
|ITEM-6| | | | | | |
fields.summary: ability to configure board constraints by multiple columns

fields.description: Availability to add Text Field (multi-line) custom field on Advanced Roadmaps since this is currently on the list of unsupported fields.
fields.summary: Availability to add Text Field (multi-line) custom field on Advanced Roadmap

fields.description: When tired to send build information to Jira issues over a commit message, the branch name evaluation by the Jira Jenkins plugin overwrites the branch inputs/ticket IDs and sends only the build result.
fields.summary: Jenkins plugin overwrites the ticket ids and sends build result

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary
Sometimes Remove Status option is not available until the page is refreshed on a board which is using Simplified Workflow.

h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Go to a board which is using a simplified workflow.
# Board Settings > Columns and delete 'In Progress' column. The 'In Progress' status will be automatically moved to 'Unmapped statuses' section, with a 'Remove status' option in it.
 !1.png|thumbnail! 
# Now add a new column called 'Build' which will automatically add new status with the same name to it.
 !2.png|thumbnail! 
# Drag 'Build' status to 'Unmapped statuses' section.
 !3.png|thumbnail! 

h3. Expected Results
The 'Remove status' option should be enabled automatically when a status is manually moved to 'Unmapped statuses' section.

h3. Actual Results
The 'Remove status' option is not shown.

h3. Workaround
Refresh the page to see 'Remove status' option.
fields.summary: Sometimes Remove Status option is not available until the page is refreshed

fields.description:
h3. Problem Statement:
When a new issue is created from Active Sprints page on a Classic scrum board, the link in the confirmation flag to "add issue to sprint" is shown.

This is confusing to the new users in Jira who don't have context of where the issues land (backlog) or how to set up or kick off a sprint etc.

h3. Additional Notes:
This link only appears if a sprint has been started on the board. When no sprint exists then no link appears
fields.summary: When a new issue is created from Active Sprints page on a Classic scrum board, the link in the confirmation flag to "add issue to sprint" is shown.

fields.description:
h3.Problem Statement:
While adding a new column to a board which is using Simplified Workflow, there is no option to chose one or more unmapped statuses to the new column. 

This sometimes can create new status (if the new column name is different from one of the unmapped status) which is unwanted and may create additional work for the Jira admins to get rid of the unwanted to status from the Project workflow.

h3. Suggested Solution:
Provide an option to select unmapped status when adding column to a board.
fields.summary: As an Admin, I want to be able to choose unmapped status(es) while adding a new Column to agile board with Simplified Workflow

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary
It is not possible to clear Target Start and Target End fields
h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Delete the values Target Start and Target End from an issue on your Advanced Roadmap plan and save the changes

h3. Expected Results
Fields should show empty
h3. Actual Results
Fields show the previous date after refreshing the web page
[^TargetFieldIssue.webm]

h3. Workaround

Currently, there is no known workaround for this behavior. A workaround will be added here when available
fields.summary: It is not possible to clear Target Start and Target End fields
Issue just appears on backlog when using watcher as a field on the filter query

fields.description:
Availability to use capacity planning on assignee level for the new Improved Interface Advanced Roadmaps.

It would definitely be helpful if we could see capacity on the assignee level (not just team level) under the Advanced Roadmap latest view, and more so because this functionality exists today (under live view).
fields.summary: Availability to use capacity planning on assignee level for the new Improved Interface Advanced Roadmaps

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary

When selecting Start/End date of a sprint, the Start/End time string is changed to "am" or "pm", not "오전" or "오후".
h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Change your profile language to Korean (한국어).
 # Go to the Backlog and edit the Start/End date of a sprint.
 # Click on Update.

h3. Expected Results

The updates to the Start/End date will be saved.
h3. Actual Results

Instead of "오전" or "오후", it shows AM/PM and it’s not possible to save the changes. 

!Screen Recording 2021-02-26 at 02.38.36 PM.gif|width=489,height=281!
h3. Workaround

Change the date format on Cog icon > System > Look and feel (instead of “a” use “k” as per [this documentation|https://docs.oracle.com/javase/6/docs/api/index.html?java/text/SimpleDateFormat.html].

!Screen Shot 2021-02-26 at 14.44.15.png|width=497,height=171!
fields.summary: Not possible to edit the Start/End date of a sprint when using Jira in Korean

fields.description:
h3. Problem
An attachment cannot be deleted, when it is added to the description, comments field, after an issue has been created. The delete button is not available for the attachment.
Issue not replicate when adding an attachment to description, comments field while creating an issue( delete button available)


h3. Environment
Jira Software
.

h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Create an issue with an attachment in the description field 
# Once the issue is created, Add another attachment to the description field or add an attachment in the Comments field on the same issue.
# You will notice first attachment has delete option 
# The attachment added in the description, comments field does not have delete option.



h3. Expected Results
Attachment should have a delete button available

h3. Actual Results
No delete button available for the attachment

h3. Workaround
Edit the description, comments field to remove the attachment, where the cross mark is available for deletion or use the old issue view
fields.summary: Cannot delete an attachment when added to description, comments field after an issue has been created

fields.description:
Currently, the share option on a board can only be used for individual users or teams. Add support for sharing with groups.
 !Jira_Share_Group_Problem.PNG|thumbnail!
fields.summary: Allow boards to be shared with groups

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary

Column page doesn't display all the statuses suitable for the board's filter.
h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Associate multiple workflows to the project. Workflows must have different statuses. 
#* !Screen Recording 2021-02-26 at 11.11.52 AM.gif|thumbnail!
 # Create a board based on this project. The filter should contain a issue type condition:
 ## *project = ABC AND (labels = XYZ or issuetype=Epic)* : Only the Epic statuses will be listed on Columns page
 ## *project = ABC and labels = XYZ or* *project = ABC* *issuetype=Epic* : Only the Epic statuses will be listed on Columns page

h3. Expected Results

All statuses suitable for the filter are displayed.
h3. Actual Results

Status are not displayed on board:
* !Screenshot 2021-02-26 at 11.12.50.png|thumbnail!
* !Screenshot 2021-02-26 at 11.13.55.png|thumbnail!
* !Screenshot 2021-02-26 at 11.14.31.png|thumbnail!
 
h3. Workaround
N/A
fields.summary: Column page doesn't display all the statuses suitable for the board's filter.

fields.description: As a Jira software user, I want to be able to order the issues (all tasks, stories, subtasks, etc) in my Kanban backlog by the Due date without them being group together into their parent issues.
fields.summary: Ability to order Kanban backlog by Due date without grouping the issues under their parents

fields.description:
As a project manager - i'd like to configure release notes to be sent over an email with a list of tickets included in a particular version. I'd like to include some other fields, like components, labels and custom fields, but they are not available as per [https://support.atlassian.com/jira-software-cloud/docs/automation-actions/#Automationactions-Lookupissues]

Is there any plan to extend this? If so - what might be an ETA?
fields.summary: Automation for Jira: extend a set of available fields in {{lookupIssues}}

fields.description:
In an older version of Jira, we had the option to access the *View all boards* page through a shortcut available at the Jira's main navigator.

As Jira's main navigator, I'm referring to the top navigation bar from where we can access the projects, filters, dashboards, people, etc. We should also have an option to access Boards through it.

Right now, we can only access the *View all boards* page through a link that is available at the project settings, and the site must contain multiple boards to have the project settings showing that link.

As a Jira Software Administrator, I would like to have a shortcut to access the *View all boards* page through Jira's main navigator.

*Workaround:*
 We can access the direct link which is *https://{color:#FF0000}sitename{color}.atlassian.net/jira/boards*
fields.summary: Add a shortcut to access "Boards" at the Jira's main navigator.

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary

You can select to open issues in the sidebar in the active sprint view, so issues will open in the sidebar instead of the pop-up dialog:
 !Screen Shot 2021-02-25 at 09.36.27.png|thumbnail! 

Currently, when you have that option active, deleting an issue will result in and endless spinner. You need to reload the page to get rid of that.

h3. Steps to Reproduce
 
* Select the option to open issues in the sidebar;
* Proceed to delete an issue in the active sprint view.

h3. Expected Results

The issue will be deleted, and the page will reload so you can navigate normally to other issues.

h3. Actual Results

You will see an endless spinner loading in the screen until you reload the page.

Here's a recording:  [^Issue deletion - open issues in sidebar.mp4] 

h3. Workaround

Reload the page so the spinner will go away.

Or, if you want to avoid the problem, keep the option to open issues in the dialog selected.
fields.summary: Deleting an issue will result in an endless spinner when you have selected to open issues in the sidebar in the active sprint view

fields.description:
I know you guys are very busy, but this idea would help many people accomplish their work faster and efficiently!

For an *efficient and time-saving* (not to mention *click-saving*) work process, it would be beneficial to have _*an option for the description on the main ticket to be automatically updated in the accompanied subtasks*_.

For instance, I could create a story assigned to 15 different people through their corresponding subtask tickets. If I need to update the description from the main Jira ticket, I currently run into the problem of having to manually click open each subtask and update the same description 15 times. The fastest way I've found to do this without this suggested feature is to open the subtasks in 15 different tabs and update the information from there.

If there was an _*+option to click+ for descriptions to be synced and be automatically updated in all subtasks* *from the main Jira ticket*_, it would *save time* needed for other projects (and frustration).

Thank you so much!!
fields.summary: An option to have descriptions on the main ticket automatically update/sync in its accompanied subtask

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary

When the board filter is updated and it stops returning a project (and its statuses), the statuses remain on board with a warning flag. 
h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Add two projects (different statuses) to the board
 # Update the board filter to return only one of the projects

h3. Expected Results

Statuses not related to the board's projects should be removed.
h3. Actual Results

Statuses remain on Column mapping
h3. Workaround

Move the statuses to the 'unmapped column' and refresh the page.
fields.summary: Remove unused statuses from Column mapping

fields.description:
h2. Background

When editing the *Fix Versions* field you can enter a non-existent version. This input will be non-tokenized text and can appear next to tokens representing valid versions.

Jira provides a handy *Create New Version* link which opens a dialog to add a version.
h2. Story

As a user, when clicking *Create New Version* I would like the non-tokenized input I typed into the *Fix Versions* field to be pre-populated into the *Name* field on the *Create version* screen. This feature would provide the following workflow:
 # View an issue
 # Click into the *Fix versions* field
 # Enter an unknown version, such as {{API 2021-02-23}}
 # Click ** *Create New Version*
 # When the *Create version* screen opens, *Name* is pre-filled with {{API 2021-02-23}}
fields.summary: Retain user input when creating a new version from the New Issue screen

fields.description:
h3. Summary

Date format error when trying to start sprint while using Czech due to capital letter in the month abbreviation.
{noformat}
„10/Bře/21 07:27 AM“ není platný formát data. Prosím zadejte datum v následujícím formátu: dd/MMM/yy h:mm a
{noformat}
h3. Steps to reproduce
 # Login to an instance.
 # Change language in profile preferences to Czech language.
 # Create a sprint.
 # Refresh the page (Backlog)
 # Press the _Start sprint_ button as soon as it is available.

h3. Expected result
The dates are shown in the correct Czech translated dated and it is possible to start the sprint.

h3. Actual results
The end date is shown with AM/PM instead of with its translation (odp.) and this prevents the format from being accepted. 

!screenshot-2.png|thumbnail!

Note: this seems to happen only when the Start Sprint button is pressed when the page is still loading.

h3. Workaround
 # Change the Week option to anything and that will refresh the date format.
# Only press the Start sprint button when the page has completely finished loading.
fields.summary: Trying to start Sprint using Czech language sometimes results in invalid date format

fields.description:
h4. Summary

Ability to see all board lists in the Issue source drop-down list in Advanced roadmap plans. Because now, *[this drop-down list|https://share.getcloudapp.com/8Luk0XEN]* returns a total of 50 boards (including next-gen). h4.
h4. Workaround

[*This video*|https://share.getcloudapp.com/wbu9z0Bg] will show how to get a board name that won't appear on the list.

Then if we type the board name, it will appear.
fields.summary: Ability to see all board lists in the Issue source drop-down list in Advanced roadmap plans

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary

Using a Kanban where the filter contains fixVersion = earliestUnreleasedVersion() causes no issue to be displayed on the board
h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Create a Kanban board
 # Update the filter with the condition fixVersion = earliestUnreleasedVersion()

h3. Expected Results

Issues from easliestUnreleasedVersion that are returned from the JQL should be visible at the board
h3. Actual Results

The board is empty.
h3. Workaround
The function earliestUnreleasedVersion() requires a project according to documentation [Advanced JQL functions|https://support.atlassian.com/jira-software-cloud/docs/advanced-search-reference-jql-functions/] in the form earliestUnreleasedVersion(PROJECT KEY). The function works in the issue navigator without a project indicated, but if used as a board filter, it will not work as expected.
fields.summary: Using a Kanban where the filter contains fixVersion = earliestUnreleasedVersion() causes no issue to be displayed on the board

fields.description:
At the moment it is not possible to focus/ grab the backlog scrollbar to move it around. For a very long backlog, it takes a while to scroll to the bottom.

h2.How to reproduce:
- Using a mac and chrome
- Navigate to the backlog
- Try to scroll down using the scrollbar handle

h2.Actual result:
- Unable to successfully grab focus on the scrollbar handle, preventing fast scrolling

h2.Expected result
- To be able to grab the scrollbar handle and fast scroll to the bottom or where ever
fields.summary: Ability to focus / grab the scrollbar handle in the backlog

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary
The JQL search for historical entries (i.e: "status was in (done)") breaks when there are multiple statuses with the same name (possible due to Next-gen). From our tests, the search *only consider the one status with the highest position* from the Status configuration page (next-gen statuses also have a position in the backstage but these are hidden from the page)

h3. Steps to Reproduce

# Create a next-gen and classic project with a repeating status name i.e: "To-Do"
# Create issues and transition them to and from the status done (so we can have a history entry)
# In the *Statuses* configuration page move the done status to the bottom of the list (to ensure that NG statuses have an upper position behind the scenes)
# Perform a historical search (i.e: status was in (done))

h3. Expected Results

* The search would return both the NG and the Classic issues, considering only the status name


h3. Actual Results

* The search will only return issues from the project from which the "Done" status has the highest position. In this example, since we moved the Classic status to the bottom, it wouldn't return its issues.

h3. Workaround

* Change the order of the statuses on the page, but it can break this for other projects.
Or,
* Use the status Id, instead of the status name in the search.
fields.summary: History search for status can break when next-gen repeats classic status names
Estimation endpoint returns wrong information when the call fails

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary
Showing the list of Statuses and scrolling up/down in Next-gen project's backlog glitches visually

h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Go to the backlog of a Next gen project (it should have enough issues to be able to scroll down and up).
# Click in the status of one of the issues near the bottom to display all the possible status it can change to.
# While the list of statuses is shown, scroll down and up.

h3. Expected Results
The backlog scrolls up and down without any issue.

h3. Actual Results
The list of statuses glitches as the scrolling happens, blinking in an out of display.

Notes: 
This does not hinder any functionality. It is just a graphical issue.

h3. Workaround
 Currently there is no known workaround for this behavior. A workaround will be added here when available
fields.summary: Showing the list of Statuses and scrolling up/down in Next-gen project's backlog glitches visually

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary
Currently, anonymous users do not see the advanced roadmap macro on a confluence page (with anonymous access granted).

h3. Current Behaviour
They get the following message on the confluence page:
 !login-to-access-plan.png|thumbnail! 

When the user has an active Atlassian account session (but no access to Jira or the Roadmap), they get the following message:
{quote}{color:red}Error rendering macro 'portfolioforjiraplan' : The link doesn't exist or you don't have permission to access it{color}{quote}

h3. Suggestion
Allow the ability for anonymous users to view roadmap plans on Confluence pages with public access.
fields.summary: Allow public users to see advanced roadmap macro in confluence page with anonymous access

fields.description:
{quote}*As a site admin*

*I want the ability to disable creation of Next-Gen projects*

*So that my instance remains consistent and supportable*
{quote}
 

Acceptance criteria:
 * Site admin may set option determining which project types are available for Create Project selection

 

Business case:

Next-Gen projects provide many excellent capabilities for simplified Jira usage. However, some of their features appear incompatible with existing Classic projects, such as propagation of Status values and altering the behavior of JQL filters, site-wide.  Once a single Next-Gen project is added, these issues appear to immutably alter the instance.  Until these compatibility issues can be fully addressed, offering site admins the ability to disable Next-Gen projects will help protect the instance from some challenges.
fields.summary: add option to disable Next-Gen projects in instance

fields.description: Currently when you create a new issue in Jira Create the Configure Fields (upper right hand corner of pop up screen) you can select the option to show 'All' or just 'Custom Fields'.* It would be ideal if there was a way to set it so that it automatically shows 'All' fields for all users.*
fields.summary: Add ability to set the default to show 'All' fields when creating new issue

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary

When using a filter including voter field on JQL of a board, it prevents all issues to be shown on the board.
h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Create a board and put some issues voted on it.
 # Edit this board filter to include the voter field.
 e. g.: {{voter not in inactiveUsers()}}
 # Save the filter and check your board again.

h3. Expected Results

Issues shown filtering by voter
h3. Actual Results

No issues are shown
h3. Workaround

None available. The only option is to remove the voter field from the JQL of the board.
fields.summary: Voter field prevent issues to be shown on boards if used on the JQL filter of the board

fields.description:
Currently, when exporting a plan's data to a CSV file, as described [here|https://confluence.atlassian.com/advancedroadmapscloud/sharing-and-exporting-plan-data-998651329.html], only the following information is exported:

* Project
* Releases
* Team
* Assignee
* Sprint
* Target start date
* Target end date
* Due date	Estimates (d)
* Parent
* Priority
* Labels
* Components
* Issue key
* Issue status
* Progress (%)
* Progress completed (d)
* Progress remaining (d)
* Progress (%) issue count (IC)
* To do IC	
* In progress IC
* Done IC
* Total IC
* Start date (roll-up)
* Start date

As we can see, the dependencies aren't exported.

As an Advanced Roadmaps user, I want the CSV export feature to include the dependencies.
fields.summary: As an Advanced Roadmaps user, I want the CSV export feature to include the dependencies

fields.description:
Currently, the photo gallery view only allows us 6 photos regardless of strip view or list view.

It would be awesome to allow unlimited photos to preview on the photo gallery view when there are many photos attached.

(i) On the old issue view, we can view all the photos on the gallery view.
fields.summary: Improve Photo Gallery View

fields.description:
As a user, I'd like to manage the projected sprint capacity as it is possible for future and active sprints.

Currently, it displays the projected sprint capacity as a colored bar, grey, green or red, but, when Red, we don't know how much % it is over its capacity nor are we able to define the Sprint capacity for that period.
 !image-2021-02-18-11-54-41-812.png|thumbnail!
fields.summary: As a user, I'd like to manage the projected sprint capacity as it is possible for future and active sprints
Slack automation

fields.description:
*Suggestion:* Allow users to change the name of a Next-Gen Board when a Sprint is active

*Expected Behaviour:* Project Admin Should be able to change the Name of a Next-gen board when a Sprint is active.

*Current Behaviour:* Project Admin cannot change the name of a board when they have an active Sprint
fields.summary: Allow users to change the name of a Next-Gen Board when a Sprint is active

fields.description:
Often transitioning from ticket STatus A -> B does not update right away. It appears to make a page load but the status is unchanged and I have to wait and reload....

Seems slow.
fields.summary: Fix State Transitions

fields.description:
While in Backlog view I expect to be able to right click -> new tab the tickets.
But I cannot as they are not links.
When I am in ticket detail I can rightclick -> new tab for subtasks.
Why isn't this consistent?

"Use the side tab" you might say. It's incredibly slow and has been on every machine / browser / project combination I've ever used for years.
fields.summary: Unable to right click new tab tickets in backlog view

fields.description:
Currently, done issues are removed after 14 days or by clearing them manually directly on the board.

It would be helpful to be able to customize the time when done issues are removed from the done column.
fields.summary: Be able to customize the time when done issues are removed from the done column in Next-gen

fields.description:
As a user, I'd like to be able to roll-down the dates from the Epic to the child issues.
It is currently only possible to roll-up the dates from child issues to the Epic.
fields.summary: As a user, I'd like to be able to roll-down the dates from the Epic to the child issues

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary
In a Kanban board with Backlog enabled, when we click on Assignee Quick filter, users can not drag and drop issues from Backlog to To Do anymore.
 it would refresh the page and keep any filters applied e.g. an assignee. Now clicking on backlog will strip off the Assignee parameter but the page will not refresh, it needs a manual refresh to view all the backlog information.

Update: This also affects Scrum boards, issues cannot be dragged to the Sprints 

h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Go to the Backlog view from a Kanban board with Ranking disabled
# Click on any assignee avatar quick filter
# Un-click the assignee avatar quick filter
# Try to move an issue from Backlog to To Do
 [Kanban|^Assignee filter issue.mp4] 
[Scrum|https://share.getcloudapp.com/o0u6nvPg]

h3. Expected Results
Users should be able to move issues from backlog 

h3. Actual Results
Kanban board becomes unusable without a refresh

h3. Workaround
Refresh the page and try again. Another option available is enable Rank with {{ORDER BY Rank}}
fields.summary: Drag and drop breaks in Backlog view after the assignee quick filter is applied

fields.description: should be able to view sub-task in backlog. Having a collapsible parent ticket would be a nice add too, allowing for current day viewing as well as extra functionality
fields.summary: view sub-task in backlog w/ collapsible parent ticket

fields.description:
our team was using RT-4155 for certain time-tracking tasks. When we migrated to the FPTP project, that ticket was migrated as well and became FPTP-377. Now that ticket has been deleted, and with it months of time tracking data.

The only thing I find is below but I need the Temp Time tracking
[https://confluence.atlassian.com/jirakb/how-to-restore-accidentally-deleted-issue-in-jira-applications-313466155.html]
 
 
The only viable way to restore an issue is to create a new instance of JIRA and restore a backup that has the issues. Then export them to a csv file and import them to your production instance. You will lose the history.
Please help
fields.summary: Missing Jira ticket

fields.description:
h3. Problem Definition

Although the stories are visible in the roadmap, it's missing the ability to re-order the child issues is not possible from the roadmap.
h3. Suggested Solution

Add the ability to rank from the Roadmap view
h3. Workaround

Child issues of the epic are ordered by Rank, and Ranking is currently done in the backlog view, switch to the backlog and rank issues as desired, the position will be reflected in the Roadmap
fields.summary: Ability to Rank Children issues in classic Roadmap view

fields.description:
h3. Description
Currently, if you add the same Fix Version value to the parent issue and its subtasks, the subtasks will also appear as issues for the Fix Version. 

h3. Suggestion
Allow users to choose whether or not to display subtasks on Fix Versions.
fields.summary: Subtasks should not appear on the Fix Version's list

fields.description:
h3. Problem
Under Global Permissions in Jira, the entry for Create next-gen projects lists Public as the User/Group. It goes on to say that anyone on the Internet can create a project. This is contrary to the description of the permission, which states that only licensed users can create next-gen projects. As far as I can tell, there is no option to change this, other than to remove the permission entirely.



h3. Suggested Solution
Please have the permission name changed from public to something which is less confusing 


h3. Why This Is Important
 Avoids confusion and Panic

h3. Workaround
_(Add a workaround, if available)_
fields.summary: GlobalPermissions -create Next-Gen Projects  permission set as Public grp creates confusion

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary

On mobile devices, cant Move issue to *Top of Backlog* on *Kanban* board.
 It returns an error "*Ask your admin for permission to view this*"
 The issue was reproduced on the iPhone, mac native app, and iPad.

User has got full permission.
h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Create a Kanban project
 # Board settings > Columns > Enable the Kanban backlog
 # Create a few issues
 # On a mobile device try to move the issue to Top of backlog

!Kanban backlog.png|thumbnail! 
 !Select the Issue to Move - Select Top of backlog.PNG|thumbnail!
h3. Expected Results

To be able to move the issue to *Top of Backlog*
h3. Actual Results

Cant move the issue to *Top of Backlog* it returns an error *Ask your admin for permission to view this*
 !Error.jpg|thumbnail!
h3. Workaround

No workaround on mobile devices.

To move the issues via the desktop.
fields.summary: On mobile devices, cant Move issue to Top of Backlog on Kanban board

fields.description: Submit feedback and suggestions change to new dragging system
fields.summary: My ID

fields.description:
Currently, when we use */jira create* command in Slack to create a Jira Issue, the issue type order is different from the order in Jira. This request is to match the issue type in Slack should follow the same order that Jira has.

- In general, while creating a Jira issue, when a default Issue Type is not selected for a project, Jira automatically picks the last IssueType that was created.

- Having the same IssueType order, will help all the users to create an Issue of the same type, no need to select it explicitly.
fields.summary: While creating Jira Issue from Slack using /jira create,make the order of IssueTypes same as the order of IssueType in Jira

fields.description:
h2. Current situation
 * The righthand side column of a detail page of epic/story/... is taking way too much space (and contains a lot of whitespace too...). This causes my main column with the important info to be too small to read easily
 * [https://community.atlassian.com/t5/Jira-Software-questions/Hide-right-panel-in-issue-view/qaq-p/1500892#U1609062]

h2. Wanted situation
 * (must have) Possibility to hide the column on the right (like the menu on the left)
 * (must have) Possibility to resize the column on the right
 * (nice to have) Better responsive design of this view...
fields.summary: Ability to hide/resize right column in story detail view

fields.description:
Advanced Roadmaps is turning out to be one of the best tools we are using at our company.

One of the only challenges we are encountering is that leadership wants the ability to comment/ask questions on the Plan.

Currently, the workaround is to embed the plan into a Confluence page which does "work" but it restricts us from having multiple views unless we embed each one specifically.
 * Allow for commenting on a specific view in Plans
 * Allow for Comments to be resolved
 * Allow for user tagging
fields.summary: Commenting in Advanced Roadmaps

fields.description: Visualize stories, tasks and subtasks that have a start- and stop date with a bar in the road map. At the moment they are placed at the start of an epic but that does not give me the overview that I need. I would like to see the tickets along the timeline.
fields.summary: Roadmap bar improvement

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary
The order of version is not respecting the release date

h3. Steps to Reproduce
1. Navigate to Project's unreleased section
2. Set the release date of the unreleased versions
 - For example, you have 3 unreleased versions i.e. release1, release2, release3 as attached.
 - Firstly set the *release date for the version1 to 25th Feb 2021*
 - Now set the *release date for version2 as 16th Feb 2021*
 - Lastly set the *release date for version3 as 10th Feb 2021*

h3. Expected Results
version1 should be on top, followed by version2 and lastly version3 under Released Versions.

h3. Actual Results
version3 is at the top, followed by version2 and lastly version1

h3. Workaround
Drag and drop the version wrt to the release date.

I have attached a screen-recording as well for reference.
fields.summary: Ordering of the release versions are not respecting the release date

fields.description:
When an Epic is deleted the Epic links from the child issues are removed but not registered in the history from the issues.

It would be helpful to have this registered to track what was the Epics in case they were accidentally deleted.
fields.summary: When an Epic is deleted the Epic links from the child issues is removed but not registered in the history

fields.description:
We recently noticed in a kanban board that when we create a *Subtask* under *Story* (that has a parent Epic), the subtask gets created UNDER epic and not Story.

This can be replicated in our test sites and the steps are shown in the screen-recording.
fields.summary: Subtask getting created under Epic rather than the concerned Story

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary

The backlog as a limit of around 5k issues to load. 

In case there are more issues than that to be displayed, the backlog won't load. The following message will be displayed instead: *Too many issues are trying to load*.

But, the backlog does not display Sub-tasks. Yet, the number of sub-tasks returned in the query is impacting that count. If there is a huge number of Sub-tasks, the backlog will not load either.

h3. Steps to Reproduce
 
* Create over 5k Sub-tasks under an issue that is being displayed in your backlog;
* Access that backlog again.

h3. Expected Results

Since Sub-tasks are not displayed in the backlog, it should still load despite the number of results of the query.

h3. Actual Results

The number of Sub-tasks is considered anyway, preventing the backlog from loading.

h3. Workaround

Adjust your filter to return less results.
fields.summary: Backlog considers number of Sub-tasks returned in the filter query even though it does not display Sub-tasks

fields.description:
h3. Problem

When a few new sub-tasks are created in a story in the backlog view, the sub-tasks are actually created in another story(the last story selected in the backlog view).

When creating subtasks from the backlog view they can get assigned to a different story. 
h3. Environment

The *video* attached to the ticket shows the issue in detail. The subtasks being created from the backlog view and they can get assigned to a different story. 

h3. Steps to Reproduce

Steps to reproduce:
 1. In the backlog view select a story(1);
 2. Select another story(2): the story you want to add subtasks to;
 3. Add at least 2 subtasks to the story(2);
 4. Select some other story on the backlog(any story);
 5. Stories a allocated to the story(1);

The history shows that the subtask gets linked to the wrong story.
h3. Expected Results

The sub-task should be created in the original story(only) where the process was made.
h3. Actual Results

The sub-task is created in another story which has no relation with the original story where it was created originally.
h3. Workaround

_Create the sub-tasks directly on the story, but not from_ _the story when_ _in the backlog issue view._
h3. Notes
fields.summary: Sub-tasks created in the wrong story when in the backlog view

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary

If you create a custom subtask in the plan, go to the review changes and the required field dialog to show up, the subtask's issue type is changed to story and cannot be changed back.
h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Add a new Sub-Task Issue Type
 # Add this to an Issue Type Scheme which is associated with a project.
 # Make some of the Jira fields like Description/Component a mandatory field.
 # Go to an Advanced Roadmap Project Plan and try to create a sub-task within a task/story
 # Click on Review changes and Save selected changes in Jira.
 # The required field dialog page is shown with the issue type set to story. The issue type is greyed out and cannot be changed. Continuing with the form and saving the issue saves it as a story

h3. Expected Results

Required field dialog should not change the issue type
h3. Actual Results

The required dialog shows the custom sub type as a story
h3. Workaround

Change the issue type to the standard sub task as it does not occur with the built in subtask.
Another option is to ensure the required fields are set so that the required field dialog is not shown.
fields.summary: Custom subtasks issue types are changed to story type on the required field dialog

fields.description: Specifically, I want to have at least two types of SubTasks that when created automatically are linked to the parent story or bug.  The default SubTask works fine, but the additional SubTask that I need is for Bugs.  More specifically Bugs that are directly and automatically related to the specific User Story being tested.  We will use the Sub-Bug for bugs raised during In Sprint testing that focuses on testing of User Story Acceptance criteria.  We will then use the separate and independent Bug issue to log Regression defects.  By default In Sprint bugs are related to a specific User Story in the current Sprint and are expected to be fixed during the current Sprint.  That's a goal.  However, Regression bugs are not related to a specific User Story by default and are added to the backlog and prioritized along with everything else in the backlog.  Regression defects can still be related to one or more Stories if needed and they can still be addressed in the current Sprint if they are critical for the completion of the current Sprint.
fields.summary: Need ability to define different types of SubTasks
